title: Collection List Dynamic Links Break in Wrapped Components

problem.description: CMS dynamic links inside Collection List items stopped working when Collection List was wrapped in a component without proper property exposure
symptoms: Dynamic links show placeholder '#' instead of CMS field data
Child components don't receive CMS context
Slider items show identical content instead of unique CMS data
Link bindings appear correct in Designer but don't work on published site
problem.context: Occurs when Collection List is placed inside a component slot without exposing the Collection Item as a component property. Common when creating custom slider or tab components that wrap CMS lists.

rootCause: Webflow components create an isolation boundary. When Collection List is wrapped in a component without exposing the Collection Item as a component property, child components lose access to the CMS data context. The component wrapper breaks the data flow chain from Collection List → Collection Item → Child Components.

solution.approach: Revert to Lumos default Clickable component pattern which maintains CMS data flow through proper property exposure

steps: Remove custom component wrapper around Collection List
Use Lumos Clickable component as designed in framework
Ensure Collection Item is exposed as component property at wrapper level
Bind child component properties to CMS fields
Verify dynamic links reference CMS link fields correctly
Test with multiple CMS items to confirm unique content per item

code.snippet:
Collection List
└─ Collection Item
   └─ Clickable Component (exposes Collection Item property)
      └─ Card Blog Component
         ├─ Image (bound to CMS featured image)
         ├─ Heading (bound to CMS post title)
         ├─ Paragraph (bound to CMS excerpt)
         └─ Link (inherits from Clickable)

properties.linkField: bound to CMS link field (e.g., blog post link)

warnings: Do NOT wrap Collection List in custom component without exposing Collection Item
Do NOT use third-party solutions like Finsweet Attributes when framework has native solution

solution.frameworkAlignment: Lumos Clickable component is specifically designed to handle this exact data flow pattern. Using framework defaults instead of custom wrappers prevents structural integrity issues and maintains proper CMS context propagation. This is a core framework pattern that should never be replaced with workarounds.

outcome.results: Dynamic links fully restored and working correctly. CMS data flows properly to all child components. Slider displays unique content for each CMS item. Links navigate to correct CMS item pages. Solution is maintainable and follows framework best practices.

metrics.developmentTime: 30 minutes to revert structure and verify

alternatives.approach: Use Finsweet Attributes for dynamic linking
pros: Familiar tool for developers experienced with Finsweet
Quick to implement if already using Finsweet
cons: Framework already has native solution (Clickable component)
Violates Lumos principle of framework-native solutions
alternatives.whyNotChosen: Lumos framework already solves this problem with the Clickable component - there is no need for a third-party solution. Prefer native framework patterns over external dependencies for better maintainability, performance, and alignment with framework principles.

alternatives.approach: Custom JavaScript to manually bind links after page load
pros: Can add custom logic to links
cons: Requires custom code for solved problem
Framework solution is cleaner and native
alternatives.whyNotChosen: Over-engineered solution for a problem the framework already solves structurally.

reusability.pattern: ALWAYS use Lumos default Clickable component for CMS Collection Items that need dynamic linking. NEVER wrap Collection Lists in components without exposing Collection Item property. This pattern applies to ALL CMS-driven clickable elements.
applicableScenarios: Blog post cards with CMS links
Product cards in sliders or grids
Team member cards with bio links
Any CMS collection where items should be clickable

template.structure: Collection List → Collection Item (with Clickable component) → Child components with CMS bindings
requiredProperties: Collection Item exposure in wrapper component
Link field binding to CMS link field
Child component properties bound to CMS fields
template.implementation: Use Clickable component from Lumos framework, ensure Collection Item property is exposed, bind link to CMS link field, add child components inside Clickable slot

updates.reason: Captured successful resolution of critical CMS integration issue

notes: This is one of the most common mistakes when working with CMS and components in Lumos/Webflow. The Clickable component pattern is fundamental to CMS integration and should be the first thing checked when dynamic links aren't working. Consider adding this to troubleshooting quick reference.
